content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
The worst Call of Duty game in the Modern Warfare series and my most dissapointing Call of Duty in the entire franchise.The game was not worth the full price when it first released and it's not worth the full price now either.Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 is not a bad game. It is very dissapointing however. Many flaws of the previous titles still remain in the multiplayer, the community seems to be even worse and the campaign...is just dull.CoD: MW3 is not the worst in the franchise *coughGhostscough* but it's the last CoD game i had high expectations for...and it just failed to deliver them making it my most dissapointing Call of Duty so far. I pretty much gave up on Call of Duty after this title altho i still enjoyed Black Ops 2 alot and i'm still planning on buying Advanced Warfare.But back to the review...The CampaignSurprise! The campaign is 6-8h long even on the hardest difficulty! Who saw that coming, eh ? I'd usually whine about short singleplayer campaigns but in this case it's actually a good thing.MW3 campaign is soo boring and tedious that after the first couple of missions it just feels like a chore not something you would do for fun.The storyline is trying to impress you too hard but it's actually just another shallow cliche story with one "oh my god! did they really just do that to HIM" moment.The only characters in the game are Makarov, Soap and Price. Everyone else is just your typical soldiers with no backround. The game also takes you all across Europe trying to mix up locations but every single country feels exactly the same. Modern Warfare 2 knew how to mix up levels: Stealthy snow section, hostage rescue on an oil rig, urban fighting in the U.S.A or guerilla fighting in shanty town. Sounds good ?Well, that's not what you'll get in this game. Just urban warfare in Europe and every city has the same looking buildings, same feel and...Well, the scenery won't change at all. The objectives are pretty much the same aswell. The campaign is bland and dissapointing.5/10 at best.The Co-opThis is where Modern Warfare 3 shines! It has different co-op missions with different objectives in it, just like in Modern Warfare 2.It also adds a whole new Survival Mode and a leveling system. You can level up and unlock gear for the survival mode.Each survival map has it's each unique waves and "bosses". Co-op is what makes up for everything bad in the rest of the game. It's just that fun! ...If you have a friend to play it with. Otherwise forget about it.9/10 - Could be better.The MultiplayerNot only is the singleplayer campaign worse than in MW1 and MW2. The multiplayer is quite similar to what MW2 had...Just a little bit worse.However, if you have to choose between playing multiplayer in here or in MW2 then choose MW3. Why ? It's easier to find matches in MW3, it has a (dead) server list and surprisingly less hacked lobbies. Modern Warfare 3 used to have more hackers / hacked lobbies than MW2 but the tides have changed. Sure, this game has it's share of hackers. I've encountered at least 5 in my 79h of multiplayer gametime. But i've only seen 1 hacked lobby so far. You can at least double the numbers in MW2.The map designs are pretty poor. The worst i've seen in a CoD game so far. There are like 2-3 good maps...Or should i say DECENT maps but the rest...They have nothing on the previous MW titles. Hell, even Blops and Blops2 have better maps in them.Noobtubes still remain as do last stand, riot shields, grenade spams and random knife "OH MY GAWD" kills. Russians and kids roam around screaming and yelling. If you do a bit better than everyone else in the lobby then you're a "confirmed hacker". It's easier just to mute everyone as soon as you get into a lobby. Save yourself from the headache.7/10 - It's the worst multiplayer in the Modern Warfare series but it's still good, it's alive, has less hackers than in MW2 and Nukes can't finish matches. Do you want to play MW2 in multiplayer but hate hackers ? Get this game!Overall score: 7/10

content:
Posted: March 18, 2014
												as an FPS 3/5 starsas a COD game, 5/5Its adequate as fps go, amazing as COD games go.For some reason it can't be minimized, literally EVERY other game I've owned can be minimized, but this one can't, and it really bugs me. The weapon system unlocks are just so tedious, it feels monotonous and just not veri intuitive, the controls are overly complex and awkward, there are (IMO) way to many weapons/attachments available, its just an unlock fest, not particularly to my taste. I'm more a class based fps kinda gal, but still, the COD series in general just pushes my buttons, that being said this is undoubtedly the best in the COD series (at least recently).Per usual with COD games its overall community is awful, don't recommend using voice chat, just saying hello can get a whole crowd of people cursing at you, probably they hear me and go "oh its a girl playing cod, ill go be a pervert to her". I have personally been trolled, inappropriately flirted with, and even threatened to be hacked in this game just for admitting I'm a girl.I know I shouldn’t judge an entire community on a few (very) bad apples, and that the game can’t be held responsible for players actions,  but when I can’t play a game because of other players behavior its an issue.So overall a mediocre game with a largely horrible player base, don't buy it if you’re not an immature jerk (if you think you can ignore it then go ahead and try). If you’re a little less tolerant of creeps than you should buy another game if you want a good fps(/tps) with a nice fanbase of people who aren't bigamists.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
												SOLID ENDING TO THE MW TRILOGYThe COD franchise started a steady decline after WAW (in my opinion, the campaigns of MW2 and BlackOps were messy and over-the-top) but MW3 brought some of the magic of COD 1 , 2 and 4 MW back. The campaign really feels like a WWIII-type scenario (ultranationalist Russia vs NATO), many of the levels are EPIC, and, while the ending feels like an epilogue (yes, the Makarov's death controversy) the rest of the game is just so ♥♥♥♥in' streamlined and addictive.Solo operations are fun as always and multiplayer is solid if you can get past the geeks and weekend keyboard warriors.Possibly the last good COD game: BOII, Ghosts, AW are just bad, style over substance, and way too many futuristic nonsense; BOII being playable in my opinion, unlike Ghosts and Advanced Nonsense)For some reason (young teens?), the post-MW3 COD games sold-are selling VERY well, but MW3 truly marks the end of the line for me, unless the company releases something truly innovative and perfect.8,5/10

content:
Posted: March 30
												It's hard to describe my overwhelming appreciation for this game, I honestly dont even know where to start.As stated in my reviews of the Modern Warfare game, I'm just going to say the multiplayer is great. However this one I especially spent a lot of time on as a kid on the Xbox 360. While I would assume at this point hackers are everywhere on this game, I cannot back that statement up because I do not play multiplayer on the PC. I can however say the experience with it I had on the 360 was great. This Multiplayer is the perfect equilibrium between practical and futuristic, which Isnt very "futuristic" at all tbh ;). Overall for Multiplayer its just a fun competitive experience, at least it was on the 360 for me.Now onto the kicker.The story is the part I have trouble expaining how good it is without repeating myself. So I will just say it is one of the most dynamic, interesting, suspensful, and downright outstanding stories I've ever played. While it does have it's flaws, it is completely made up for by the ending of this game. I can't stress enough how fantastic the Modern Warfare series is as a whole in the story department, so I will leave it at this...If you havent played it, you are missing out bigtime, it is far better than any other story in any FPS in my personal opinion.The game itself is fine, graphics are decent, engine is alright, and its easy to run on the card I played it on (GTX 750 Ti). I dont play these games for the functionality of it however, the story makes it not matter to me.Once again, great game here. If you dont have it you should. The story will leave you content and you wont regret the rage inducing gameplay if you play on a hard difficulty ;).10/10

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												The 8th iterration in Activision's long running game series, MW3 is a major letdown to all Call of Duty fans. The onrail singleplayer, the fun-stripped multiplayer and the lack of major innovation all contribute to this feeling. However, there are some things done right, if not many.Starting with the singleplayer, it continues the trend of mindless action initiated with MW2. This would not be that much of a problem, as even some of the best titles in the series (CoD4, CoD2) don't have the most complex storylines, but in this  game it feels like the developpers first thought of what cool set piece they should introduce and built around that, when they should've made something more contextually appropriate (the example closest to mind is the mission where you use an armed ROV to effortlessly destroy the enemy). Most of the gimmicks that you see in singleplayer are put there because Sledgehammer Games wanted to justify various killstreaks that you can use in multiplayer. Despite all this, there is one small flash of brilliance in the campaign of MW3 and that is its ending mission. While it may not be amongst the most memorable in the series (Hill 400 in CoD2, Heat in CoD4, Vendetta and the final mission in CoD WaW), it certainly stands on its own as a fairly satisfying conclusion to the Modern Warfare series and it is quite a fun ride.Moving on, let's talk about the multiplayer which is mostly a mix of good and bad. One major complaint I have with the game is the levels on weapons and the need to earn XP for each weapon in order to unlock Proficiencies and attachments for it. This is a step in the complete wrong direction, even after Treyarch nailed it with the ability to buy which attachment or camo you want. Furthermore, the Proficiencies you can unlock for each weapon create massive disparities between newer and older players. This is most visible when using shotguns which have 2 Proficiencies that are vital: Range and Damage. Both of these are gained at  the last levels of the weapon, a decision I find most absurd. You will have to play most of your first 40 levels without them, which makes it really hard for you to perform with shotguns, especially the weaker AA-12. To make things worse, deathstreaks have returned, worse than ever, there even being a killstreak that shows you were your killer is. However, there were quite a few "innovations" introduced, such as the new killstreak system and the new gamemodes (Kill Confirmed, One in the Chamber, Gun Game etc.). The former is a pretty big improvement, making it possible to set custom killstreaks for each individual class. Also, they are now divided into 3 categories: Offensive (identical to the previous system), Support (similar to the Offensive, but the streak is not lost upon death) and Specialist (instead of killstreaks you gain perks and at 8 kills you unlock all the perks). There is also the MOAB, which is attained by getting 25 points in a row (kills from other killstreaks dont count, making Specialist the best option for people who aim for this). In addition, the newly added Kill Confirmed mode is one of the best ever made in the series (you win by obtaining a number of points for your team; points are gained by collecting tags dropped upon death by enemies; enemies can deny you tags by picking them from their fallen comrades). The multiplayer is pretty fun for a while, but it gets boring much faster than its predecessors, making the initial investment less worth it.However, the best component by far is Special Ops. It has missions that have no connection to the storyline of the game, but they are very enjoyable and can also be completed solo if one would want a more challenging experience. These are a blast and made me reminisce about the missions in CoDs past, surpassing their singleplayer counterparts. There is also a sort of horde mode, which pits against opponents that become tougher with each round that passes and you can buy weapons much like you could in the zombie modes in CoD WaW, BO and BO2.Regarding technical aspects, the game ran fairly well, rarely dropping frames, but it also doesn't have much graphical fidelity to show, sporting the same recycled game engine since CoD2. It somehow manages to look worse than its 2 closest predecessors, MW2 and BO.To conclude, MW3 is a fairly mediocre game, even amongst its own series. Its campaign is shallow and painfully linear, the multiplayer is fun, but for a really short time and the game as a whole is hardly an improvement in any way over the games it succedes. If I were to rate it, I would give it a 6/10, a buy barely suited to the long time CoD fans, let alone the average gamer.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2016
												I have had this game on PS3 and have enjoyed it a lot. Unfortunately my PS3 got RLOD and I couldnt play anymore. I bought MW3 for 5 eur because it is one of the last interesting Call of Duty title.  Singleplayer: - The Modern Warfare triology has a best story compared to other Call of Duty. - The player would feel attached to mostly every character, protagonists and antagonists alike: Soap, Price, Makarov.- Classic american piece of proganda: USA got struck down but heroically fought back and save the world singlehandedly (the whole Europe is taken out easily), with of course, pure evil, warmonging Russians who wants to dominate the world but are brought to their knee while begging for peace treaty. Spec-ops/Co-op :- The spec-ops missions are carefully designed.- The survival mode has no story like in Zombies Mode. just survive wave-to-wave until you die. Also, the gameplay is pretty much straightforward: unlock armories, weapons, perks through progression and I expected a Zombies like gameplay with sci-fi guns. Multilplayer: - Much fun with the multiplayer: fast-paced, casual gameplay.- There are always something new but nothing really changed. Conclusion :- In the time, it was good, I enjoyed it a lot. Battlefield manage to surpass Call of Duty from that point forward, and I played Battlefield eversince. It is recommeded if the game is on sale and < 10 eur with a score of 7/10.

content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
												Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 meets expectations. The core elements of multiplayer and the campaign remain fundamentally unchanged, but the game serves as a great example of how many subtle tweaks can add up to an improved overall product. Some will be disappointed by the fact that MW3 is not a drastic departure from previous iterations of the series and that is a very valid criticism. MW3 still offers so much content and still proves to be one of the best online experiences around. MW3 is a game that will certainly keep you busy until some new cod release. Snipers are awesome. L118A Bolt Cancelling <3 MsR is also pretty good though I prefer L118A. And,lastly VAC is playing a great part in banning cheaters.

												You open your eyes, finding yourself crouching behind some boxes, waiting for 'bloody screen' to go away, surrounded by rushing, endlessly respawning enemies, shooting your gun, throwing grenades, trying to listen to all of the bubbly mess injected to your ears by panicked officers, explosions everywhere, sparkles, dust, blood squirts, jets flying over your head launching missiles that unleash hell of death and destruction...And I'm in the middle of that pandemonium, sitting on my♥♥♥♥♥wondering... why is this so ♥♥♥♥ing boring? :o I was genuinely exhausted of this game in the middle of the 2nd mission :D It's so loud, so linear, so badly designed (corridor with waypoints triggering another horde of enemies), controls suck and are unresponsive, the amount of military american macho ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is mind boggling and it's just a miserable fps experience overall.Rising the price of the game just before the sale is a cherry on top of the crap cake. GG Activision, you nailed it this time. One of the worst games that I've ever played.EDIT: ah what the ♥♥♥♥, I requested refund for this pile of garbage, because I can.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												I'm gonna start off this review with the word No.No, and before you call of duty lovers start hating on me for all this just take into account that if you like this game that is strictly your opinion and I know I cannot stop you from downvoting this post but this is what I extracted from my gameplay.*SINGLE PLAYER*Playing the campaign on this game is not as fun as slowly sawing off your testicles with a butter knife. The storyline was purely milked for grief with all the death in it. With soap dying and all these slo motion bulls*** death scenes, really created no badass moments for me personally in the game. I remember the campaign of MW2 front to back because of one small reason, it was actually good. Now you will see people crying over the death's of some in the game, but all the company will notice from me is 60 dollars less then their normal standard. The graphics are grainy and dissapointing to view. There was no uniqueness in any of the new guns and if there was any, it was a bad uniqueness. *MULTIPLAYER*Now the maps for mw3 to your surprise I actually didn't completely hate, as I watched how they urged a slightly 3-laned maps but slightly not was okay, but still♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off. They maintained some of their secret ledges and spots that were on mw2 previously. But the influence of so many hackers shows that the company does not give two walking cat craps about their community base and they just wanted to push the game out for money. Also considering that its the PC copy doenst help much with the overall give-a-sh** level. The pc servers are mostly laggy and not satisfying to play on. The characters move too fast and it feels like your health level is lower than my expectations for black ops 3. The gun camos are all crappy and sandpapery. Along with the guns and the changes to them, they all seem the same like I said earlier and don't exemplify the right work being done when fired. They all♥♥♥♥♥♥me off when I shoot them and half the time lag and glitch and make me reload a few times before it works. Its all sandy and seems like they are just paper guns with some low quality texturing on it. For the DLC portion, they were so out of ideas for good maps that they had to bring back old maps to make people like their new game more. Why not make new maps that people will want to see more of instead of bring back the old ones like Terminal.*Spec ops*MW2 spec ops was alright but you can't expect people to like mediokre a second time. The missions were kind of boring and annoying to complete. I did enjoy the rank up system though that was a pretty cool feature that ties in with survival.*Survival*I didn't like it but at least it wasn't an early access open world survival gamemode.This game is like dropping a cake on the ground and picking up all the pieces off the ground and putting it back on the plate and serving it. It seems like they just took the MW2 game files and erased the 2 and added a 3 but replaced the old maps with sh*t maps.4/10 Would rather play my Wii.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												Derided by some and often touted as a Modern Warfare 2 clone, Modern Warfare 3 is actually a very good cap off to a fantastic series. There's nothing cloneworthy about this entry in the Call of Duty franchise as you fight back the Russian invasion in the United States and slog through varied environments with Price and Soap while you hunt for Makarov across the globe. The visuals are crisp enough and the atmosphere matches the tone and pace of the game perfectly. It feels like a world on the brink of annihilation. The audio adds to the feelings. From the guns firing to ambient effects all the way through the voice acting, it is superb and reflects well upon the art direction of the game.The story, for me, was an incredible finish to a powerful story arc. From the battles in New York and Germany to the slog through Africa and the backalleys of Prague, the story is fast and powerful. The turn in Prague is especially gripping as two of my favorite characters, Soap and Kamarov, meet savage ends. It was at that moment I kept playing until I finished the campaign and killed Makarov. The decision to kill two key characters from MW and MW2 was powerful and gave me a sense of urgency to find the man responsible. Never have I felt such satisfaction from finishing a villain. The only other villian that gave me that much enjoyment from finally killing was Jack from Borderlands 2. Truly, the story board direction was top notch and I give them high praise for giving us a gripping, powerful and semi-cinematic experience to enjoy.However, I know everyone loves the multiplayer more than the story. Even in this department, there's no shortage of things to do. While nearly MW2 2.0, there's enough differences in perks, weapons and equipment to keep from being too stale. Thankfully, silliness like Danger Close and Stopping Power did not make a resurgence in this iteration. Overall, I've enjoyed the MW3 multiplayer more than MW2. There's more modes and arguably better balance.I fully recommend this title. If you play for the story, make sure you play Modern Warfare 1 and 2 so you're up to speed. For you multiplayer fans looking for a fast, furious game, this will not disappoint.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												Modern Warfare 3 is the last Great installment in the COD franchise. The multiplayer is very well balanced. Most of the maps are very well designed, the guns have been balanced very well to the point that it now is based on the players skill with the weapon not his spraying bullets. Sure you can spray bullets but good luck on ammo if that is all you do. Gun damage has been well balanced, just about all the hackers have at one point or another been vac banned and therefore are no longer active playing. I know this to be true as i checked some steam accounts and found them to be banned along with the fact that there was no more activity in the game. The game has been out for a long time but has many many players still. It is second place in players in the COD franchise.Single PlayerStory is very good continuing in the MW series of the story. I would have to say that my favorite storyline in the MW series was COD 4: Modern Warfare. But the story in this installment is still very good.I have over 800 hours in this game and i still play it. It is fun and if you have not purchased it you are really missing out :-)

content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
												One minor problem (if you care about this sort of thing) no other reviewers seem to have pointed out: stats for Spec Ops Mission and Survival modes played solo offline will not upload/update online, i.e. if you want your mission scores to count for ranking, you must play them online (solo or co-op) or else your highscores will not be listed (in case you want to compare them with your friends'). Also, there is a small bug in which your score might not be saved after finishing Fire Mission (online co-op), but it will still award however many stars you selected for difficulty after completion and count toward the "Tactician" and "Overachiever" achievements.Everything else has already been said.

The visuals are crisp enough and the atmosphere matches the tone and pace of the game perfectly. It feels like a world on the brink of annihilation. The audio adds to the feelings. From the guns firing to ambient effects all the way through the voice acting, it is superb and reflects well upon the art direction of the game.The story, for me, was an incredible finish to a powerful story arc. From the battles in New York and Germany to the slog through Africa and the backalleys of Prague, the story is fast and powerful. The turn in Prague is especially gripping as two of my favorite characters, Soap and Kamarov, meet savage ends. It was at that moment I kept playing until I finished the campaign and killed Makarov. The decision to kill two key characters from MW and MW2 was powerful and gave me a sense of urgency to find the man responsible. Never have I felt such satisfaction from finishing a villain. The only other villian that gave me that much enjoyment from finally killing was Jack from Borderlands 2. Truly, the story board direction was top notch and I give them high praise for giving us a gripping, powerful and semi-cinematic experience to enjoy.However, I know everyone loves the multiplayer more than the story. Even in this department, there's no shortage of things to do. While nearly MW2 2.0, there's enough differences in perks, weapons and equipment to keep from being too stale. Thankfully, silliness like Danger Close and Stopping Power did not make a resurgence in this iteration. Overall, I've enjoyed the MW3 multiplayer more than MW2. There's more modes and arguably better balance.I fully recommend this title. If you play for the story, make sure you play Modern Warfare 1 and 2 so you're up to speed. For you multiplayer fans looking for a fast, furious game, this will not disappoint.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												A highly satisfying finale to a breathtaking series. Set in an authentic, believable environment, Modern Warfare 3 brings to bear open armed conflict in real life locales like never before. The streets, buildings, posters and magazines in the local vendors bring a new degree of realism to the monitor. The weapon effects are superb and the stealth is highly suspenseful. The group dynamics are nigh on perfect. Each squad member coordinates expertely with the other and if you follow their lead and pick off enemies as they do, you can be a valuable member of the team. The enemy AI is challenging and will give you a hard time if you let them take cover and spread their numbers. Fortunately, your own and the advanced weapons at your disposal help even the odds nicely.Modern Warfare polishes the game engine in all the right places and heightens the tension with expertly written sudden events that can lead to your death if you fail to act quickly enough. In story this installment helps to finally put an end to the Russian threat once and for all in a very satisfying manner. It can be tough, especially for those who are new to squad shooters, but to play the game and finish it is a very worthwhile and rewarding experience.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Out of the entire Call of Duty: Modern Warfare franchise, CoD: MW3 definitely provides the best multiplayer experience. The graphics are highly realistic, the maps are diversely different and well constructed and the many multiplayer gameplay modes can be altered to create even more custom gameplay modes! Weapon loadouts are very clearly organized and changing or creating your own custom loudouts is as easy as a few clicks. The choice of guns are great and the numerous gun modifications and upgrades make your weapons more personal and suited to your needs. Servers are created based on online players within a certain region who become automatically grouped together and a host is randomly chosen - which is a great idea because you never have to manually browse servers and you won't end up in a server by yourself! Achievements are as awesome as they can get and the slow-mo final killshot replay at the end of each round is epic - especially if it was you who made the kill!

												Let's be honest, anyone who didn't think this game was going to suck a fat one when it launched had either never played the previous game or lived in some fictional world where large gaming companies never try to ♥♥♥♥ consumers out of their money. Whatever the case may be, we once again find ourselves on our backs, bare-chested, with Infinity Ward humbly squatting over us, patiently waiting to give us our due.  You want more guns?  We’ll give you less guns!  You want better perks?  We’ll give you ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ perks!  You want memorable multiplayer maps?  Here, enjoy small run down village; not to be confused with slightly larger run down village.  They mock you every step of the way as you fall deeper and deeper into state of bitterness and flaccidity that no amount of Redtube can remedy.  If mw2 was 2% milk then mw3 is skim, which expired a month prior, and was then♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥in by a hobo with genital warts.  Save your money for Train simulator 2 when it comes out, a far better purchase.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2014
												Stuffy marasmus in which the Call of Duty series stays today, personally for me reached apogee in the second mission. During deep diversion over group of fearless marines the submarine with evil Russians floats. The commander of office it is squeezed hisses in a handheld transceiver: "Not to move! " For harm (and with boredom) I nevertheless decide to swim for a while slightly... and right there I learn that it is impossible to move — for the period of a scene management is disconnected. Call of Duty left school old kind the zaskriptovannykh of the shooters which have promptly become fashionable after Half-Life. Certainly, authors the most noble motives — beautifully to make to players directed and to tell juicy, coherent story moreover and about war. In years this desire didn't weaken at all, but the methods, which set didn't change never in nine years, as a result finished series to the point of absurdity and idiotic scenes like that that is described slightly above. Our today's task — to try to understand as it turned out and what to do farther. That Modern Warfare 3 was on sale huge circulation — isn't surprising. First, Infinity Ward have strong standing on the feet multiplayer, and secondly, in the world still there are enough aged people from seven to seventy which didn't play enough in war. But in this review we would like to address not to them (they made the choice, you won't overpersuade), and to those who, as well as we, I saw during a century not one and not two Call of Duty, to those who testified all contemporary history of series and quite I acquired simple rules by which it works. For all of us Modern Warfare 3 — a heartrending experience. Actually matter isn't that at Infinity Ward bad game turned out. Modern Warfare 3 — it by and large at all game is simple. Games assume interactivity, any dialogue with the user and possibility of the last to influence the world created by developers. In Modern Warfare 3 you have four options: it is possible to run or not to run, and also to shoot or not to shoot. The rest game does all. Itself lets out in the field of new supernumeraries, itself arranges between them fights, itself blows up houses and breaks furniture... You need to run only in time in the right places, activating scripts. Once I made experiment: during hot firefight I sat down in a corner, it is simple not to stand absolutely in the firing line then rose because of the computer and I left the room of minutes on fifteen. Naturally, to my return me not that didn't kill — I as though didn't leave at all the room, firefight proceeded at the same speed and, it seems (precisely you won't tell, enemies as like as two peas), in the same structure. Heroes of Modern Warfare 3 even refuse to die if nearby there is no player. (This my opinion and it can not coincide with yours).

content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
												Modern Warfare 3 is a really well optimized and fun game to play, the story continues on from the ending of Modern Warfare 2, it is very well written and the game looks really good considering it came out back in 2011.                      Pros: The game runs and performs really well, had a constant 60FPS!                               using Nvidia's DSR (Dynamic Super Resolution from 4K to 1080P),                               while also using MFAA (Multi Frame Anti Alising) and every other game setting                               maxed out.                               The story is great and it has a good soundtrack to it.                              Plenty to do: Intel Collectibles, Special Ops Missions, Survival Missions, Veteran Difficulty and                              Multiplayer if you are into it.                              Captain Price! (The Dude's A Beast!).                              Cons: Activision's price for the game and the DLC (even during the sales).

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												For the first review since recovering my account i have chosen Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3. I played this game on both PS3 and Cpu. It is a great game and sums up the story for our beloved Modern Warfare characters. The game is not very difficult and has a decent replay value. Multiplayer has not suffered a hit as i find Modern Warfare 3 to be quite appealing. My main focus however is and always has been in the Campaign. To say the least it was great i realy enjoyed it, exempting a few plot twists but maybe im just sentimental. Also for PS3 gamers Modern Warfare 3 is a very easy Platinum Trophey. NO INTERNET REQUIRED. split screen play for 2 spec ops missions is all the help you will need.  If you want a quick easy Platinum go get this game! thats it for this one. I did not go in depth because of the age of this game but i will make more detailed reviews as i upgrade my game library. If you want more reviews or any help with PS3 titles please contact me via messege on Steam or PSN account cperkins110.  -Christian

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												Here we have it. Quite possibly the last of the Modern Warfare series. MW3 is kind of on the borderline between the good CODs and the bad CODs. If you wish to finish the series, by all means give it a go. However, if you are buying this just for the heck of it, don't (wait a few years). Instead, try MW1. I will not refer to the campain; I could accidently spoil something. The multiplayer is well rounded, although i do think that maps should be larger and spawns more reasonable (trust me; they are terrible). Overall, I believe that this is a well rounded game, again, right on that borderline.

												How to play Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 - Multiplayer:Step 1: Locate the game’s files and open config_mp.cfg with Notepad. Find ‘seta cg_chatHeight’ and change the value to ‘0’. This will remove the text chat from visibility.Step 2: After joining every single game, race the clock to mute every single player before the game starts.Step 3: Enjoy the game, completely free of the mind-numbing stupidity and hatred of a million degenerate mouthbreathers. Single-player review I liked playing the story mode of Modern Warfare 3 than Advanced Warfare to be honest. Regarding the story, I'm certain it's really short. Overall, it's just like another Call of Duty game, there's hardly any new changes that (atleast) I could witness. At one point of time, due to subtle name changes, I was really confused when I checked Kamarov was actually pulling me up at one time, and then we were fighting Makarov.In the end, it's certainly not worth their asking price. Just buy it at its cheapest selling price. I haven't explored their multi-player yet. Not really going to do it, based on the reviews on Steam.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2013
												-The SP campaign is like a popcorn action movie, entertaining and action filled. It delivers a good story, fun to use guns, and a theater of combat and action to fight through. You know what to expect in the SP campaign, the story & voice acting are good, the levels are entertaining.-Spec Ops originally had a problem with desyncing that has been fixed, making it possible to finish with an advanced option video frame sync option (can you believe the default choice is set to ruin the game?).-Survival is actually very fun, unlike boring♥♥♥♥♥black ops zombie mode.  The Spec ops missions are a lot of fun & a huge draw in this game, the first 3 DLC packs add more spec ops missions which are also lots of fun and a lot harder than the regular levels sometimes.For what this game aims to be, it accomplishes that.  Having fixed the desyncing spec ops issue, I can say it was a 10/10 for what I expected & what was delivered, but I understand a lot of people are sick of the CoD model.  I don't mess around in MP, so I rate this as someone who enjoys SP campaigns & coop.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2014
												An Epic conclusion to the Epic Saga!The modern Warfare series has come a long way ever since the first modern warfare released in 2006. It has evolutionized the genre and changed the way we play and think of FPS games. Althought, the game adds nothing new to the already complex formula, it does adds smoothness to the game core mechanics and the fast paced arcade-style shooter, ranking & rewarding as well as unique kill streak system in which skillful players shall go on a rampage quite easily with the aid of air supports or ground fire powers.The thrid entry to the series does not dissappoint because the single player campaign is filled with action as well as intense sequences. The story is well written and completed the story in a consistent and well told narrative. It also did a great job on connecting all the previous games together while maintaining twists that will keep the player guessing with unpredictably deep story. The story mode does not have a good replayability unless you are a collection fanatic that will be interested in perfecting the game with enemy intels, other wise I'd say it is not worth the hassle. The music score is an honorable mention here as the composer Brian Tayler has really hit the score with the music on the battlefield as well as the impact of guns and bullets hitting different places. The sound track is overall excellent not only does it set a atmospherical environment but it also connects the emotional link between the players and the characters and maintaining this link is what gives us the reason to care about the characters.In terms of multiplayer, the same formula applies. It is still addictive and still fun as new weapons and maps being added but the only down side to that is that additional DLCs will cost a fortune. Overall I will recommend this game to all FPS lovers and action gamers in general.

												This review is based on my opinion, and you could disagree with me. Modern Warfare 3, a sequel to the previous Modern Warfare games in the Call of Duty series. Both Modern Warfare one and two were greatly reviewed and I must say that this game holds the pride of the Modern Warfare series. The multiplayer of this game is very well done. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 26, 2015
												This review may be long overdue but I'm going to write it anyways just for the record.MW3 is perhaps one of the best COD to be released by IW. MW2 had some rather annoying balancing quirks, and Ghosts was a dismal failure, as far as I'm concerned. But of course, one ought not to forget the modern classic in the form of the first MW, which was a true phenomenon.MW3 just like any MW had impressive map designs. Some may call it straightforward, but it's a proven philosophy as per the first MW. Contrast this with Treyarch's map design, which the word "maze" should properly sum it all up. Sledgehammer on the other hand seems to be taking the middle road but I reckon it's more identical to Treyarch's.Then let's talk about weapons and killstreaks. Recoil is pretty much non-existence so that makes it accessible to couch gamers on consoles. For the PC, do expect faster response time and reflexes as usual. The killstreak system is probably the best part of this game, allowing one to select how he/she would earn those killstreaks.Overall, MW3 is a commendable COD title. If you plan to pick this one up, well you're in luck to know that there are still players out there.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Sooo...Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3! lets begin the review.Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 is the third game in the modern warfare franchise and my personal favourite! This game , has everything what MW2 had , but this has even more.The Story starts after MW2 , and continoues the "adventure" of John Price and Soap.In this game , you play with tons of characters. Buut there are lot of problems! You only play Soap for like 3 minute or less :( , after that , he always gonna be an A.I. The Main playable character is Yuri and Frost ( hohohoho :D ). Yuri is an Ex-Spetnas soldier , who helps Soap and Price to hunt down Makarov. Frost is a Delta force soldier assigned to Team Metal. there are other characters like the british Marcus "Burns" , an another Russian operator wich i cant remember..the story is pretty good in the game! same as MW2 , there are lot of epic moments! In overall , story is awesome! now , theres the Spec Ops mode from MW2 , but its been modified a bit. now there's 2 kind of things you can do : "Missions" ( like in MW2 ) and "Survival"both these can be done in coop , but Survival..man..that mode is a bless from the gods! About Multiplayer , i think this is the best CoD MW multi , i like to play it!Lets see the results  Positives :-Awesome Story and characters-Some characters from CoD4MW are in this game!!-Personal best MW-A nice end to the Modern Warfare seriesNegatives :-Graphics look outdated , even worse then MW2-Many questions unanswered-Only can play Soap for 3 minutes :(my final score for MW3 is a 9/10 ! i find this game to be good! get it on a sale or CD version :D on Steam every CoD is high priced

content:
Posted: March 9, 2013
												По сути старая К0лДа, ток с чуть другим сюжетом и оружием. Весьма короткая. Лично мне, понадобилось около 6 часов, что бы все пробежать игру. При этом заглядывая по многим уголкам локаций.  Сюжет достойный американской публики. Ведь там, можно убивать русских. И весьма в больших кол-вах. При этом, слушая своих обреченных на смерть соратников, можно услышать акцент американского происхождения. Что порой вытягивает улыбку. Разработчики подумали, что русской публике, придеться весьма не по вкусу данное сюжетное новшество. И решили запихнуть "пародию" геноцида русских в BO 2. Где мы играя шахидом,убиваем якобы американсов. Но присмотревшись.. я никак не заметил ни одного намека на американских солдат. Модели фрагов были обычными шахидами, которым я и играл на тот момент. И то, разроботчики и тут не обошлись без подкола нас. Как муравьев, что они давят сапогами все чаще, и всунули нам игру в Афгане. Где мы играем снова восточными "славянами" снова убивая бедных русских. При этом крича какие мы "няши". Лично мне это не нравится, и уже игра не столь серьезна, как бы этого хотелось бы видеть. Вроде бы взрослые люди, а видна какая то холодная обида. ЧТо пропагандируется в таком вот виде игровой индустрии. Т.е. если раньше мы убивали немцов с въетнамцами, то теперь, русские заменили эту "интилигенцию".  Спасает только Мультик. В котором решает более или менее скил. Если он есть.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2012
												Mixed bag here. If you're a fellow Single Player like me, there's really only 2 things drawing you to this game- that's the campaign and the Spec Ops Missions, many of which are playable as Single Player, with a few co-op missions added in as well. The campaign can be completed in around 4 hours, little longer if you're hunting intel or other achievements. Spec Ops missions are where the fun is at though. They require more skill than the campaign.*Now I don't play mp- but from what I've heard, it's a camp-fest full of aimbotters, quick-scopers and the like. Kind of an 'enter at your own risk' mode. I have heard of many gamers that strictly bought it for the mp disgusted with it and regretting their purchase - so 'buyer be ware' applies more than usual here.The ultimate question is, 'do you think you can have enough fun/time with this game to make it worthy of the price?'. For me, it was easier. This game shows in my Steam games, but I bought the physical disc- with coupons/cheaper.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 21, 2015
												Pros:The same great action of the previous games. Lots of multiplayer options.Cons:Not much changed since Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. Single-player campaign is confusing for people who haven't played the other Modern Warfare games. Modern Warfare 3 picks up where Modern Warfare 2 left off. I mean, exactly where it left off. Russia is at war with America, Makarov is at large, Soap's injured, and everything is blowing up. If you didn't play Modern Warfare 2, which served as a decent starting point and didn't require the first game to understand it, you won't have any idea about what's going on, and the game doesn't do much to get you up to date. It feels very much like the third movie in a trilogy, and the second movie ended on a cliffhanger. The gameplay, both in single player and multiplayer modes, is identical to that of Modern Warfare 2. You can carry two weapons and two types of grenades (one offensive, one special) at one time and you have to hide behind cover and employ tactical savvy in your approach firefights if you want to kill your enemies. It's an established and functional style that captures modern, "realistic" first-person shooter games. If you get hit a few times, you need to hide behind cover until you heal, or a few more stray bullets can kill you. It's unforgiving, but balanced.Multiplayer is the big draw of Modern Warfare 3, and it pays off just as much as it did in the other games in the series. There are the same seemingly endless customization options, with an experience system and the ability to build your own class with different weapons and abilities. The killstreak system from previous games has been refined into a points-based system that gives players more balance. Instead of getting points for each kill, players can choose Assault, Support, and Specialist modes that give them different rewards. Assault is the traditional killstreak system, where you get new abilities like missile strikes for more kills in a single life. Support counts your kills and other actions between lives, constantly moving up and giving you support-based abilities like UAVs. Specialist gives you more perks for your kills, instead of new weapons it effectively turns you into a super-soldier who's faster, stronger, or able to take more damage.The multiplayer options offer a benefit over Battlefield 3, which only has six cooperative missions compared to over a dozen in Modern Warfare 3. Competitive play is pretty evenly matched, with leveling in Modern Warfare 3 universal and steadily unlocking weapons and skills and leveling in Battlefield 3 and rewarding your class as you play it. The big difference between the two games is that Battlefield 3 has vehicles, which can change the nature of a game dramatically. To go to extremes, Modern Warfare 3 is more suitable for Counter-Strike fans, while Battlefield 3 is more suitable for Halo fans, but the distinction between the two modern combat games are far smaller than the rift between the two classic shooters.Modern Warfare 3 is a solid follow-up to Modern Warfare 2 and Black Ops, and if you loved those games you'll love this one. It doesn't change anything big, and the single-player campaign wraps up a story with most of the exposition lodged in previous games, but it offers a great multiplayer experience and a solid, if predictable and occasionally frustrating, single-player experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												Every year there's always new CoD. To be honest, from Infinity Ward it's still the same game. They made awesome titles like CoD 2, 4 or MW2. I liked it because the storyline was amazing. The engine upgrades and really cool multiplayer. It wasn't the same thing like now. But MW3 was just recycled CoD 4 with MW2 together. I liked it, enjoyed it and I also have +350 hours on multiplayer. It's really chatchy game.But I hate the community. Who wants to play with aimbotting kids, screaming in the voice chat and camping somewhere where you can't see them ? But that's multiplayer. Let's talk about campaign. It's the last Modern Warfare from thrilogy. What do you want to expect ? Awesome breath-taking missions ? Some kind of plot-twist in campaign ? Mindblowing actions ? No. They just killed the game. You will experience few "stealth" missions, shooting at some Africans, rescuing, and of course, grand finale. With few new characters, you will be basically for entire game, trying to save President and his daughter from Makarov's hands. There comes Chuck Norr..ehm..Captain Price with god-mode and kills everyone, without getting shot in the body. But what I enjoyed mostly is Spec Ops, which is also in MW2. Co-op missions are always fun with friend, but now there's brand new survival mode. But witout zombies. DLC 3 adds another game mode called Chaos, which is actually really big chaos and I like it. Kinda like survival, but faster. So I'm still recommending this game, but as I said, mostly for Spec Ops than campaign and MP.6/10

content:
Posted: March 9, 2013
												По сути старая К0лДа, ток с чуть другим сюжетом и оружием. Весьма короткая. Лично мне, понадобилось около 6 часов, что бы все пробежать игру. При этом заглядывая по многим уголкам локаций.  Сюжет достойный американской публики. Ведь там, можно убивать русских. И весьма в больших кол-вах. При этом, слушая своих обреченных на смерть соратников, можно услышать акцент американского происхождения. Что порой вытягивает улыбку. Разработчики подумали, что русской публике, придеться весьма не по вкусу данное сюжетное новшество. И решили запихнуть "пародию" геноцида русских в BO 2. Где мы играя шахидом,убиваем якобы американсов. Но присмотревшись.. я никак не заметил ни одного намека на американских солдат. Модели фрагов были обычными шахидами, которым я и играл на тот момент. И то, разроботчики и тут не обошлись без подкола нас. Как муравьев, что они давят сапогами все чаще, и всунули нам игру в Афгане. Где мы играем снова восточными "славянами" снова убивая бедных русских. При этом крича какие мы "няши". Лично мне это не нравится, и уже игра не столь серьезна, как бы этого хотелось бы видеть. Вроде бы взрослые люди, а видна какая то холодная обида. ЧТо пропагандируется в таком вот виде игровой индустрии. Т.е. если раньше мы убивали немцов с въетнамцами, то теперь, русские заменили эту "интилигенцию".  Спасает только Мультик. В котором решает более или менее скил. Если он есть.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Sooo...Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3! lets begin the review.Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 is the third game in the modern warfare franchise and my personal favourite! This game , has everything what MW2 had , but this has even more.The Story starts after MW2 , and continoues the "adventure" of John Price and Soap.In this game , you play with tons of characters. Buut there are lot of problems! You only play Soap for like 3 minute or less :( , after that , he always gonna be an A.I. The Main playable character is Yuri and Frost ( hohohoho :D ). Yuri is an Ex-Spetnas soldier , who helps Soap and Price to hunt down Makarov. Frost is a Delta force soldier assigned to Team Metal. there are other characters like the british Marcus "Burns" , an another Russian operator wich i cant remember..the story is pretty good in the game! same as MW2 , there are lot of epic moments! In overall , story is awesome! now , theres the Spec Ops mode from MW2 , but its been modified a bit. now there's 2 kind of things you can do : "Missions" ( like in MW2 ) and "Survival"both these can be done in coop , but Survival..man..that mode is a bless from the gods! About Multiplayer , i think this is the best CoD MW multi , i like to play it!Lets see the results  Positives :-Awesome Story and characters-Some characters from CoD4MW are in this game!!-Personal best MW-A nice end to the Modern Warfare seriesNegatives :-Graphics look outdated , even worse then MW2-Many questions unanswered-Only can play Soap for 3 minutes :(my final score for MW3 is a 9/10 ! i find this game to be good! get it on a sale or CD version :D on Steam every CoD is high priced

content:
Posted: November 19, 2011
												Bought it for 60$ at launch. It contains alot of content with his in depth Multiplayer and Co-Op that can easily suck you in. If you played the previous titles in this series you might end up like I did - getting that feeling the you already had a familiar experience before, the multiplayer felt pretty dull after the 40 hours mark so I started orginazing matches with friends and even against other clans, which has a pleasure - the good old shooting mechanics feel as good as always and never get's old. Still, the game doesn't feels worth it's value.The Singleplayer is a great additive, nice story that wind up the MW series with it's unforgetable ending, yet as expexted it's very short, but the Spec Ops missions and the survival mode got it covered, they a huge fun even on solo. A partner to the Spec Ops is a delight, but I felt the game lacked a 4-players Co-Op.I do reccommend the game, but if you are willing to buy it now, do yourself a favor and wait for a discount, and I seggust you to buy it with some friends.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												(This review's overview will be divided into two sections, one for Singleplayer, and one for Multiplayer)PROS: - Amazing campaign - Stunning high-graphic visuals - BEST Call of Duty Multiplayer experience ever - Tons of feedback to the playerCONS: - Cocky players - Unbalanced map layouts (Exception for a few)SINGLEPLAYER OVERVIEW:     As the third, and final, installment into the Modern Warfare series, this one does not hold back. It takes a huge leap and hits you hard. The campaign puts you in the eyes of many characters, making for a big experience so you know what all these people are like so you can understand why things play out the way they do. This game goes over the top in visual quality and storytelling, actually giving the most player-friendly story ever told in Call of Duty. It's an immersive experience, and pure fun to partake in. No mission is left to bore you and each one has it's own way of developing the story, which is normally lengthed to 2-3 missions in a Call of Duty game.MULTIPLAYER OVERVIEW:     In my honest opinion, if you want the fullest experience of Call of Duty: MW3, playing Hardcore is the way to go. Players don't rush and actually think. giving you a fighting chance since you both don't run at eachother. As for the gamemodes, this game provides the most ammount of gamemodes i've ever seen in any Call of Duty game to date. And these modes are not forgiving to you as the player. You're in to play, not ♥♥♥♥ around. As for maps, a lot of them seems unbalanced and don't really help the player in moving through a game smoothly. It all feels very choppy and poorly programmed. Some maps are an exception though, and in the end, its just how you feel about the maps.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7
												Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 was released in 2011. It’s a first-person shooter by Infinity Ward and Sledgehammer Games. Published by Activision. A direct sequel to 2009’s Modern Warfare 2.Once again you play as different characters throughout the game. Continuing straight after the events of Modern Warfare 2, Captain John Price, and Nikolai evacuate an injured Soap MacTavish to a safe-house in Northern India. Makarov (from the previous game) has sent out a force to kill them. That’s where the game starts. The war between Russia and United States soon ends when the U.S. regains control of their military infrastructure. Meanwhile Makarov attempts to take hostage the Russian President who is brokering a peace deal with the U.S.The missions of the game are separated into Acts. With multiple missions in each Act. The combat system has not changed since the last game. Health regenerates quickly after being hit, showing a red splatter on the screen to show how bad you are hurt. The ammo is plenty with no real need to resupply during the game. Once again moving forward is how you progress through the game.Using the IW5 Game engine the weather and environmental effects are much improved as well as the visual quality of the environment. The story is overshadowed by the continuous action packed style of the game play.  I enjoyed this game more than Modern Warfare 2 but not as much as the original Modern Warfare. I like how you get to control modern military equipment like helicopter guns, UAV’s and laptops that control air strikes etc.There are many locations throughout the game and the change of scenery kept me interested. I thought the story was getting a bit old in the tooth and boring after three games. Voice acting and cut scenes were all done well, same can be said from the performances of the soldiers who accompany you throughout the game.Overall I found this game enjoyable to play and worth the money I spent. Rated Mature.I give it 8.9/10

content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												(This review's overview will be divided into two sections, one for Singleplayer, and one for Multiplayer)PROS: - Amazing campaign - Stunning high-graphic visuals - BEST Call of Duty Multiplayer experience ever - Tons of feedback to the playerCONS: - Cocky players - Unbalanced map layouts (Exception for a few)SINGLEPLAYER OVERVIEW:     As the third, and final, installment into the Modern Warfare series, this one does not hold back. It takes a huge leap and hits you hard. The campaign puts you in the eyes of many characters, making for a big experience so you know what all these people are like so you can understand why things play out the way they do. This game goes over the top in visual quality and storytelling, actually giving the most player-friendly story ever told in Call of Duty. It's an immersive experience, and pure fun to partake in. No mission is left to bore you and each one has it's own way of developing the story, which is normally lengthed to 2-3 missions in a Call of Duty game.MULTIPLAYER OVERVIEW:     In my honest opinion, if you want the fullest experience of Call of Duty: MW3, playing Hardcore is the way to go. Players don't rush and actually think. giving you a fighting chance since you both don't run at eachother. As for the gamemodes, this game provides the most ammount of gamemodes i've ever seen in any Call of Duty game to date. And these modes are not forgiving to you as the player. You're in to play, not ♥♥♥♥ around. As for maps, a lot of them seems unbalanced and don't really help the player in moving through a game smoothly. It all feels very choppy and poorly programmed. Some maps are an exception though, and in the end, its just how you feel about the maps.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
												It's a game with guns... pew, pew!Okay, i'm serious now, this game is amazing! The graphics are ok for the time, but the real thing is the gameplay. You have a campaign continuing the things that happend in MW2, And also 4 dificulties. The dificulties are: Recruit, Regular, Hardened, and veteran. The dificulties have little mesages to: Recruit= For players who are new to first-person action games; Regular= Your abilities on combat will be tested; Hardened= Your Skills will be strained; Veteran= You will not survive.You also have a Special ops witch includes survival! and you can play missions too. The real fun is when you get a friend to play a friend to play over with you (Don't know if it works localy though) all the missions and survive with you. The survival is basicly you or your friend choses a map and then you get waves thrown at you (Not sure if wave limit exists though). The multiplayer is what you expect from a call of duty game. Custom classes, game modes (A lot of them), killstreaks or scorestreaks and thats it. It improves allot on the multiplayer from MW2 bit i still find MW2's multyplayer fun. The game is challenging in a good way, exept for multiplayer. Hackers rule in multiplayer while we are just a little guy getting killed over and over again, So heres some advice for InfinityWard: Add anti-cheat stuff! Anyways the game is good.Graphics: 7/10Challenge: 8.3/10Fun:8.5/10Everything: 8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												I believe I have the knowledge and experiance as an avid call of duty player, on PC & Console to judge this highly acclaimed and commerically successful first-person-shooter game; it is known as the 8th instalment to the Call of Duty franchise and 3rd to the Modern Warfare series, COD: Modern Warfare 3. CAMPAIGN:Pick up the story right where Modern Warfare 2 ended and continue the intense single-player experience. Also, gain hidden enemy intel as you progress through the missions. The story is split into three Acts, each with 6 missions apart from Act 3. Total = 17 Missions. Each mission played will be by the opperatvies: Frost, Yuri or Price. Also, The each mission has at least one support character to assist you much like Cod 4. The game  Avg completion time is 7 hours; but completion time varies dependent on difficulty setting and PC specs. I would Rate the Campaign a 8/10MULTIPLAYER:You get to: Rank up, unlock new weapons, perks, killstreaks, play on servers and much, much more, online or locally. Possibly the most addictive multiplayer game in my steam libary of games. Quick scopping is very enjoyable and is satisfying getting multiple kills. Ui is solid, Hit detection is good. In comparison, games are ruined by hackers if you get into a lobby with one then you can expect, God mode, aimbot, wallhacks, high jump, unable to move etc... I would Rate the Multiplayer an 8/10 SPECIAL OPS:playing solo or co-op, rank up to unlock new weapons, tactical support, levels, and more in Survival mode and in a variety of challenging Missions. Survival:Survival mode is fun with a friend, its is waves of enemies, much like zombies from black ops 1 but with guns, helecopters, dogs, juggs etc... All maps are coppied from multiplayerMissions:Missions are really fun imo, I would say the best part of the game.  I would Rate Special ops a 9/10Conclution: The graphics seem rushed when developed and i have noticed they look better in multiplayer, the gameplay is very climatic and filled with imersive moments and you actually feel upset for when soap dies. I would recomend getting this game, although it is far from perfect, it adds retail value from the last game. Unfortuanely to add, the Game is unfortuantely filled with hackers. Special ops is really good, its in my opinion the best game mode out of the three!

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												Another return to the great COD franchise before Treyarch took over.Although Sledgehammer games took over after Infinity Ward got shafted, this game I feel best mirrors the previous greatest iteration of the COD franchise which was CODMW2.Not a fan of Advanced Warfare or Black Ops, but of this game yes.Looking for the game closes to the previous Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2? This is it.Trademark blockbuster explosions and action? Check.Trademark graphics? Check.Symphonic score and full orchestra to accompany explosions? Check.No silly spacesuits, jumpsuits or gravity guns? Check.Missions take place in a variety of locations, from Sierra Leone to the UK.Notable missions include:-  playing SAS at the warehouse. Love those hammy British accents and LIttle Bird Helicopters.-  Operating the Hind remote machine gun.-  fighting through Paris-  calling in artillery strikes with purple smoke-  operating the AC-130 Gunship in ParisThe Special Ops section is where things get stupid fast.The Solo survival missions are beyond dumb. The AI are bullet sponges and you barely have enough time to buy new weapons and ammo. It gets boring fast.Playing Advanced Warfare for me meant a big break from what COD meant. Not a fan of the newer releases which are too tech-oriented and futuristic.The campaign is a bit short but given teh amount of explosions, battles, cinematic cut scenes is well worth it, but only if you manage to buy it elsewhere on sale.Got this for 9$ onsale on♥♥♥♥♥ Not worth the 43$ on steamb but if you find it elsewhere definitely consider getting it.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2014
												I've bought this game in the U.S. when I was on a trip there. It was on discount (now Iknow why). I usually start playing in multiplayer mode after I finished the campaign, so my article is mostly about the multiplayer experience. Let's see the Pros:-Call of Duty game-Lots of weapons-Usual Call of Duty graphics-good Single player campaign story (at last they've finished it!)And now let's see the Cons:-the worst Call of Duty Multiplayer game I've ever played (played almost all the episodes)-You will be angry even before the match starts-Lot of connection problems (If you've played even 10 minutes with it, you understand what I'm saying)-Annoying Kill Streak rewards-Lots of campers and kids who don't even know what this game is about-lots of people who can't play and start cheating, ruining all the game and fun of others.-at least 10 game modes (but 99% of MW3 players use the standard TDM...)-If you don't have at least a 1 Gbps Internet connection, don't even try it!-Lot of DLC-s which would be essential if you want to play (these costs about 3 times the price of the game)I think that's all I can say about it. I spent many hours trying to find what's good in this game, but in the end, I always quit with the anger and the dissapointment with the question in my mind: Why the hell did i just buy this? (the answer is: franchise advertising). People nowadays (unfortunately me too) only looks at a cover, or advertising, and if the name is familiar, we go and buy it. We shouldn't!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												The Good: Slight visual upgrade for PC, multiplayer is fun an addictive as always, new weapons, a couple of favorite maps from the past returnThe Bad: Campaign lacks the thrills of past games, not much has changed in multiplayer, too many cheaters due to lack of dedicated servers, feels like Modern Warfare 2.5Modern Warfare gets the bad rep of being the game that sheep flock to. “Only morons play it” some people say. “The only people online are 12 year olds”. The problem is that those are true, but it doesn’t mean that it isn’t a fun game. Sure, the game became too mainstream to everyone and their mom has played this, but it doesn’t make it is a bad game or series. What makes the game tiring is that nothing really changes. Modern Warfare 3 feels like Modern Warfare 2.5. Not much has changed from the second game other than the campaign and a visual upgrade. There are even recycled maps from the second game!The campaign is a disappointment because it just doesn’t feel as awesome as the past two games. It feels like a gallery shooter more than ever and has very little challenge. The epic set pieces aren’t as grand as previous games, and have great potential at first, but no climax ever happens. Levels are really short without the varied gameplay clips that are thrown in. The story is confusing if you haven’t followed the games until now, but you aren’t missing much. The story between Captain Price and Soap MacTavish are interesting, but it just falls flat in the end. The campaign is entertaining at best and a lot of fun, but it isn’t solid like the past two games. What you are mainly here is for multiplayer because that will keep you coming back for more.The layout is like all previous Modern Warfare games without much change. You can customize your loadout, callsign, emblem, and unlock new items through ranking up. The only new additions really are how you score. Things like rescuing people and a few other things. To be honest the controls and feeling of the entire game haven’t really changed much. There’s a few tweaks here and there but it doesn’t feel like an actual sequel. The weapons are a little different, but everything is just the same when it comes to how you unlock them. There are a few different kill streak rewards like the IMS and a few others, but if it ain’t broke don’t fix it right? There are a few different perks and that is really it. The maps aren’t designed as well as the past two games and aren’t as memorable. There are a couple of maps in here from MW2 like the Airport map which is a classic, but the others have to just grow on you. There are a lot more modes in this one, but I was missing the modes from Black Ops which I felt should have been included. One in the Chamber was a favorite of mine, but the whole money system from Black Ops is also missing. I would rather buy upgrades than wait to unlock them, but what can you do?The graphics received a huge upgrade and look decent on PC, but look pretty bad on the consoles. There’s a slight texture upgrade, some SSAO effects, and anti-aliasing but they are all very minor. You don’t need a powerful rig to run this game maxed out. There are a few cool scenes in the campaign, but overall this doesn’t feel like a true sequel, but more of an expansion. Multiplayer is super fun and most players will pour dozens of hours into the addictivness of it. There are a few complaints about the multiplayer such as when you start. You are fighting people who are level 80 prestige and have all the best stuff, so don’t get discouraged. Quick scoping is a thing people complain about where you can look down your scope almost instantly which is considered cheating by some. They fixed this by making it a perk, but if you play Battlefield 3 you will notice the difference.Modern Warfare 3 has a lackluster single player campaign, and not much has changed in multiplayer. The new maps are fun but not as memorable as past games.--Score: 8.5/10

Most of the guns are pretty balanced (except the ACR and the MP7) and you should like most of the maps. The best part is,is the game isnt dead. Most of the gamemodes are still populated (with 12 year olds). It still has a pretty big community and if you use a toaster and a laptop then goodnews you can still play this game on decent settings. Listen I know I suck big balls in writing reviews but I hope I convinced you to buy this game and if not then an other suggestion on what to spend with your $40 is to upgrade to a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥premium account. It never hurts! But seriously buy this game its worth it.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 is the last game from MW trilogy. In this game developers tried to remove some of the things that players didn't like in previous CoDs (kniferunning, noobtubing etc.), but in my opinion they picked wrong ways how to do that. For example Marathon perk gave players unlimited sprint in MW2 and it was something usefull, in MW3 they wanted to remove kniferunning so they decided it will be only longer sprint and it made that perk totally useless, because there are much more usefull perks now in that category, like Scavenger. But these things doesn't matter that much, MW3 is one of the best CoDs with classic style (no flying suits etc.) and it's still played a lot. If you are looking for some good old CoD then i recommend this game for you. Result: 9,5/10 (just because of those limits and other things that should remove some stuff from the game but it doesn't and it did more bad than good, otherwise it would be 10/10)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Call of Duty: Modern War Crimes is a fun arcade shooter for anyone who is a fan of crappy graphics and the same guns copy and pasted over and over again. This game includes everything, from killing militant children in Sierra Leone to having WMDs bomb major European cities.CAMPAIGN     I didn't play much, but it's essentially a huge coalition trying to take down one very evil dude who controls "other-but-lesser-evil" dudes who do evil stuff to the protagonists. I don't know...SPECIAL OPS     This gamemode is fun if you've never played Zombies in World at War or the Black Ops series. JK. It's fun to a certain audience, mainly the people who get frustrated after being destroyed by 14 year olds with Doge profile pics and "MLG" anywhere within their names. Survival is a gamemode where the player is inserted into a multiplayer map alone or with a single partner and defends an area against waves of enemies. The players can buy support options unlocked with XP earned during each round.MULTIPLAYER     The multiplayer is the game's most re-playable feature. The ACR, MP7, and Strikers are the most overpowered weapons in the game. Killstreaks are "revamped" and the "Create a Class" system doesn't use currency. "Kill Confirmed" and "Team Defender" are modes not previously found in older segments of the franchise. The maps are all based on campaign missions, so it gives you a sense of "I've seen and done this or that." The glorious PC master race also gives us dedicated servers (which are really fun), and the options to increase the FOV (not built in to the game, but you won't be VAC banned for third party mods.)FINAL THOUGHTS     Infinity Ward might make the next Call of Duty. Given their history, it might turn out good (COD 4) or bad (Ghosts.) But lets hope it's not "MW4." This game may suit your playstyle for your first COD, and if you're thinking about getting this for the PC, you should also consider there will be hackers and the problems of your opponent having a better computer. This port doesn't live up to the memories I had on the Xbox, but it may be a good way to fill your Steam library with variety.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2011
												So far I'm  very impressed with   the overall feel of MW3.  As you'd expect with C.O.D. games this is a non-stop in yer face  killing fest, full of action and  amazing visuals.  The developer has added some interesting and varied missions that involve several  scenarios such as   scuba diving and manning a mini gun from a chopper while making your escape from  the first mission.  I've yet to explore the multiplayer aspect of the game (co-op for me), but then I tend to concentrate on the single player   parts of  a game first.  It's hard to  make a real comparison  between  MW3  and Battlefield 3, but  IMO  so far Battlefield 3  wins.  Although both single player campaigns are  rather scripted,  the battlefield  experience left me  feeling  lot more satisfied than the COD experience.  BF3 is a harder game with more of a feel of a real military sim than COD:MW3.  If you're into FPS games then both should be on your shopping list (if you don't already own them.  . Acvtivision rocks!  :)

content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												You noob!Omg you suck!U mad?These are only few examples, of the fascinating language common midst Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 players. On a linguistic side of things, we have come far from our ancestors, the primates. In Modern Warfare 3, you still can have that primal feeling and rage within, which is very common amongst our hairy friends. When you’re on fire, and only need one kill for your AC-130 gunship, this kind of language feels the proper way to express yourself. It might not be suited for every Modern Warfare 3 players. You can use terms like; owned, haxor and cheater too. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 is first person shooter, developed by Infinity Ward and Sledgehammer Games, with Raven Software having assisted in development and published by Activision. Sales figures for Modern warfare 3 in US and UK,  reported by Activision, being more than 6.5 million copies sold on launch day and grossed $400 million alone in its first 24 hours. This fact alone proves that humankind has progressed from primates. Apes and monkeys didn’t have currency available. French site TF1 News reported of two masked individuals, hijacking a truck transporting 6000 copies of Modern Warfare 3, using a teargas and vehicle as a battering ram, on November 6. 2011. I’m quite sure; they were masks to hide their hairy faces from the truck driver. They were ape-men capable of complicating task of hijacking a transport vehicle. Modern Warfare 3 is a game for men and women, who want to see blood spilled. You could argument Modern Warfare 3 might be used to numb human masses, to receive better understanding concerning our ancestors. Primates didn’t have high tech toys of war, like unmanned aerial vehicles or intelligent munitions systems. They weren’t able to use other than simple tools against each other. Within these sidelines, I can recommend Call of Duty: Modern of Warfare 3 to all humans, of all races above the planet earth. If you are too young to play this game, you might want to study the behavior of primates while waiting.Before you go, imagine yourself as a super soldier, capable of dominating every human being on this planet, with your weapons and perks like recon pro, and extreme condition pro. Your bullets and explosives becomes your all seeing radar. You are running two marathons in a day easily. Suddenly you start to sing Mc Hammer’s song, U can’t touch this. You see something moving from the corner of your eye. You turn, and you’re facing the biggest and baddest looking juggernaut, equipped with the M60E4 LMG and Mp412 handgun coming straight at you. Your mouse hands starts to shake and sweat. Your mouth is getting dry. You shoot. You hear a loud bang. Smoke everywhere. Juggernaut is dead. Mighty juggernaut has fallen. And you write to the chat; U mad bro?
