content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												DISCLAIMER: I do not play the competitive multiplayer mode at all. My review is based solely on my experience on the single player campaign and the co-op multiplayer game modes.The single player campaign is still one hell of an awesome game! This time it wraps up the story of the modern warfare franchise, and the ending is super awesome! Similar to their prequels, you switch roles in-between campaigns to play on different settings and experience different play styles. One moment you are an army boy in a warzone, another moment you are playing stealthily while infiltrating a fortress. There are not much new game mechanic from the old games, except a few new guns. But this time you can finally play as the juggernaut in one of the later stage!When compared to the previous modern warfare games, this one has the easiest single player campaigns. It has very little solo stages, and your ally AI is pretty good. When playing the hardest difficulty, I feel like playing an escort mission from the start to the end, with me being the escortee and the NPCs are my bodyguards!Special Ops have some interesting co-op missions. This game mode however, is very susceptible to poor network connection between players. When you have a poor network condition, the game will kinda de-sync by itself, where both player don't even notice they have disconnected from each other. This is very frustrating and game-breaking. I recommend using either Steam voice chat or 3rd party voice chat client like Skype while playing with a friend. The in-game chat is very bad.For achievement collectorsThese DLCs are required for 100% completion.Collection 1 DLC Collection 2 DLC Collection 3 DLCYou will also need a co-op buddy to complete some of the Special Ops missions. All achievements are not difficult to obtain, the hardest ones just need some practice and patience.My score: 8/10

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 12, 2013
												The current generation of gamers mainly consist of people who dislike innovation and are looking for the same thing over and over again. It is companies like Activision we can blame for the recent decline in the Japanese games industry we have unfortunately witnessed. CoD brought the sequelitis disease into gaming, which basically means a franchise bringing new installments annually with no significant changes. Modern Warfare 3 is the third time the same game has been released, only with a few online changes that would prove little challenge to have released as DLC or a patch for the first game, and an even more absurd, generic plot ripped from a low budget action flick filled with painful cliches. It saddens me to see CoD do so well in an industry where a lot of hidden gems do not recieve such recognition, while they are ones who truly deserve it. If you are a mindless child whose pea sized brain can handle nothing more than easy to follow shooters with about 6 hours of true gameplay, then you may enjoy this mediocre game. If you are even remotely intelligent, then save your money.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												The single player game is quite fun, but the multiplayer sucks completely.   If you want a game to play by yourself, this is fine.   But if you want game you can play with friends and have a replayable experience... this is not the game for you.   Cheaters are all over the place.  Hackers are a constant.  Hacked lobbies are routine.  You can't hardly get into one single game, where there are no cheaters.  You are pretty much required to download an admin tool, that allows you to kick and ban cheaters, but the tool only works if you magically end up with host.   If you don't have host, you are at the mercy of other players who do.      The game could be easily fixed, but the company isn't going to, because there is no profit in it.  I have spent 2 hours, to play only one ten minute game that was actually worth playing.    The rest of the time, all you do is try and dodge hackers, get host only to lose host, and get kicked, or spend time kicking cheater and hackers.   The game is miserable to play as a multiplayer game.   I wish I had not spent the money on this game.  I would gladly delete it for a refund.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2012
												What can I say that I haven't said about the CoD games before?  Like Far Cry 2  the scenery is beautiful but the progress is a dire slog.  The setpieces are sharp with lots of variety and attention to detail but you can't stop to appreciate it without becoming swiss cheese.  The whack-a-mole shooting gallery is very tiresome because it forbids you from playing smartly or carefully.  You shoot one guy and another instantly replaces him.  Crysis combat is SO much more satisfying.  There's some fun breaks when you pilot drones, remote turrets, and the AC-130, but what I really want is a greater sense of accomplishment.  I can't appreciate the story because it's so fractured from too many POV's and I get annoyed by the game taking control away from me to deliver "dramatic" moments.  Who is Yuri?  Or Frost?  Why does Makarov have a hate for Price when his motive was to start WW3? I'm supposed to care when teammates die?  A better game to watch than to play.  Audio is A+ however.

content:

												The end of the Modern Warfare franchise. The campaign has epic moments and a very good ending. If you want to play a cooperative gamemode, you can play the Special Ops missions or you can try the Survival gamemode, where you have to survive against multiple waves of enemies, also you can buy weapons, perks and equipment to make your survival easier. The Multiplayer is very good, maybe some weapons and some perks are too overpowered but still a great multiplayer game, in this game you can prestige pretty fast so its kinda cool, too bad this game is filled with hackers, i would still play this game if it was clean of hackers. Even if this game is ruined by those idiots, i still recommend it for the Campaign.

Игра превратилась в мусор (так и была с самого начала, т.к. не успела появится, как в ней появились читы, а за ними читеры) только из-за того, что в отличий от MW2, кол-во читеров в MW3 зашкаливает.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												The single player game is quite fun, but the multiplayer sucks completely.   If you want a game to play by yourself, this is fine.   But if you want game you can play with friends and have a replayable experience... this is not the game for you.   Cheaters are all over the place.  Hackers are a constant.  Hacked lobbies are routine.  You can't hardly get into one single game, where there are no cheaters.  You are pretty much required to download an admin tool, that allows you to kick and ban cheaters, but the tool only works if you magically end up with host.   If you don't have host, you are at the mercy of other players who do.      The game could be easily fixed, but the company isn't going to, because there is no profit in it.  I have spent 2 hours, to play only one ten minute game that was actually worth playing.    The rest of the time, all you do is try and dodge hackers, get host only to lose host, and get kicked, or spend time kicking cheater and hackers.   The game is miserable to play as a multiplayer game.   I wish I had not spent the money on this game.  I would gladly delete it for a refund.

												This is probably one of the best FPS games out there.  The campaign aspect of the game is well put together.  The graphics and gameplay is smooth and very stable.  YMMV with online game play.  I highly recommend a good internet connection of at least 75 Mb (Megabits, not bytes) down and 15 Mb up for good game play.  Anything less will give you a decided disadvantage.  The only real drawback to this game is all the hackers and cheaters.  That is to be expected in just about all online games.  But, the fact that this game does not have dedicated server support makes it a favorite target for unscrupulous players.  I highly recommend using an approved Server Admin Tool to help deal with cheaters (it's only good if you have host).

content:
Posted: March 25, 2014
												Campaign sucks, not even gonna discuss that. It's no surprise in an IW game. Survival is really fun though, atleast with a friend. You can level up in survival to be able to buy better things like new weapons and equipment, also perks.I've put 370-ish hours into this game's multiplayer so you're probably thinking "Wow, what a CoD kid" right about now, but I really hate this game in most aspects lol. There's sooo many hackers in this game, you wouldn't believe it. IW doesn't give two ♥♥♥♥s about their games so they don't really do anything about it. When there are no hackers this game is really good though (If you're good at fast paced FPS atleast). The weapons are unbalanced as hell, although IW has actually boosted some weapons (not nerfed any of them tho) to make them atleast slightly up to par with the dominant weapons (the M16A4 used to take 3 bursts to kill, now it takes 1-2, an ACR takes 2 bullets to kill). Pretty much all weapons are fun to use, only a few exceptions like semi-auto snipers and the PM-9 which is like an UZI. Weapon levels eliminates the need to play with attachments that aren't good for your gun in order to unlock the best attachments, and it also eliminates the need to perform X amount of headshots to get camos, although level 30 to 31 (gold camo level) takes a looong time to unlock.Overall, this game is really fun but only fun on others accord. I usually own the pants of most people but only because I use so overpowered weapons and tactics most of the time. People can't really get mad at others for using those tactics either so everytime I get killed by someone when I'm using an average weapon I think "Damn him for using that weapon!" but I always use it myself to make people angry just like he made me angry by using it. It's a fun game, it's just really frustrating and unbalanced.I recommend it if you can stand the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and the ever so many hackers.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2014
												It's great. It's the mostly simple and easy-to-play FPS series to date. There is no skill involved so anyone can play it.It's exactly the same as Cod4:MW and Modern Warfare 2, just with a 3 in the name. So you don't have to worry about learning curve if you've already played those games.Given how old the game is now, I'd imagine the price would fit nicely at £10-12, especially given how often these games come out, so you collectors would probably want to wait until a price reduction of 75%.Having said that, we all know how Activision are barely managing to pay the bills and cloth little Jimmy, so we can all forgive how every single CoD game releases at £40 and stays that way for as long as possible.If you want to play CoD Ghosts but don't want to deal with the bugs, the lack of any optimization and not have to spend £40-60, then get this game at 50% off! It's a steal when you consider how it's the EXACT SAME GAME but better!Wow!Or you could play Planetside 2 and not spend a dime, but yeah.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2012
												Ok, I finished the SP campaign, and can officially comment on it. Generally the campaign is thrilling, with some fantastic sequences we've all wanted to experience, like swimming through a devastated lincoln tunnel, or running though a building on the verge of collapsing.  However, this is the most restrictive COD to date in terms of player choices... some scenes require a specific path or key sequence that sometimes just require trial and error to discover the path or timing.  The story is a bit predictable with no twists to speak of.  I also played some Spec Ops and Multiplayer, a refinement over the previous version.  I would say that BLOPS is a better effort overall but MW3 was still a thrill to play.  Wait for it to go on sale... $60 is too much.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												I completed the solo once, forgot about it immediately, and finished all spec ops missions in co-op with a friend. I barely tried the survival mode, and mainly played MW3 for its multiplayer. Of course. If you liked MW2 multiplayer, you'll like MW3 multiplayer. At least I did. They share the same ingredients, and (almost) the same recipe. Expect no more, i.e. small maps & fast pace: spawn, run, shoot, kill, run, shoot, die, rage. And start all over again. Personally, I liked the addition of the Specialist class, which fitted better to my play style. However, there were far too many kill streaks spamming every game. Spawn kills also remained an issue, evidently. Desertion to the new title every year, leaving empty lobbies after one year, may also be a show-stopper. All in all, it's an ideal game for releasing the pressure & frustration after long days of work, and blaming everything and everyone for each of your death in a deluge of bad faith arguments. Good old times.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2011
												Single-player:The single-player portion of COD somehow disappointed me a little bit. I don't know why. I guess the story went a little overboard as well. Still, there are some really cool set pieces and the action never stops. In the end the game ended on a satisfying note. But I do hope they'll drastically update their engine for the next COD or create a new one altogether. Let's just hope it will perform the same as these CODs then (60FPS solid).On the other hand, the co-op part is really awesome. The Last Stand campaign really is brilliant, and hard. Plus, there are lots of maps. Only downside is that it's limited to 2 players max. So finding a buddy that doesn't disconnect halfway through or even knows how to play it at all is difficult. But when you do find one it's most of the times great.The co-op missions are in there as well. They start off pretty easy, but get harder quite quickly. Also limited to 2 players unfortunately. But fun nonetheless, especially on Veteran mode.Multiplayer:Still king of the FPS multiplayer. It's MW2 all over again, with some much needed change all around. Well, change is a big word, but there are some updated mechanics, new modes, perks and uncountable unlockables. Remember how Black Ops played somehow differently ? Well, MW3 plays exactly like MW2; fast-paced and without stuttering. It's brilliant ! I guess 'if it ain't broke, don't fix it' really applies to the COD series these days. I don't mind though since it gets better with every MW.I'll be playing this for a long, long time.Insta-buy ! [Rating: 90/100]
